text: Terres-de-Haute-Charente is a commune in the department of Charente, southwestern France. It was established on 1 January 2019 by merger of the former communes of Roumazières-Loubert (the seat), Genouillac, Mazières, La Péruse and Suris.Arrêté préfectoral 28 September 2018, p. 19 == See also == *Communes of the Charente department == References == Category:Communes of Charente
title: Terres-de-Haute-Charente
